content.query:
-- This is auto-generated code
SELECT * FROM sys.external_data_sources

SELECT
    TOP 100 *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'trip_data_green_parquet/year=2020/month=01/',
        -- Always specify the Data_Source when you refer folder rahter than entire link in the BULK
        DATA_SOURCE = 'nyc_taxi_data_raw',
        FORMAT = 'PARQUET'
    ) AS [result]




-- It infers data types correct because file is Parquet File
-- But only for the String Characters it gives VARCHAR(8000) which is slow and costly
-- Thats why most of the time even for parquet you manually specify the column types.

EXEC sp_describe_first_result_set N'SELECT
    TOP 100 *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK ''trip_data_green_parquet/year=2020/month=01/'',
        DATA_SOURCE = ''nyc_taxi_data_raw'',
        FORMAT = ''PARQUET''
    ) AS [result]'



-- Query from Delta File
-- DElta stores in PArquet format, but you can UPDATE, Time Version with the help of _delta_log folder.
SELECT
    TOP 100 *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'trip_data_green_delta/',
        -- Always specify the Data_Source when you refer folder rahter than entire link in the BULK
        DATA_SOURCE = 'nyc_taxi_data_raw',
        FORMAT = 'DELTA'
    ) AS [result]



-- You can choose the specified columns but only in the case when you specify the partitioning column names
-- You should only specify the root folder in the BULK, because _delta_log folder is located in the Root. not in the individual partitions.
SELECT
    TOP 100 *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'trip_data_green_delta/',
        DATA_SOURCE = 'nyc_taxi_data_raw',
        FORMAT = 'DELTA'
    )
    WITH (
        tip_amount FLOAT,
        trip_type INT
    ) AS [result]



SELECT
    TOP 100 *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'trip_data_green_delta/',
        DATA_SOURCE = 'nyc_taxi_data_raw',
        FORMAT = 'DELTA'
    )
    WITH (
        tip_amount FLOAT,
        trip_type INT        
    ) AS [result]
